name: Application.cfc
description: Defines application level variables and event handlers (functions invoked at various application lifecycle events).

params.name: this.name
params.description: Name of application. Up to 64 characters

params.name: this.loginStorage
params.description:
cookie: store login information in the Cookie scope.
 session: store login information in the Session scope.

params.name: this.clientManagement
params.description: enables client variables

params.name: this.clientStorage
params.description:
How client variables are stored
 * datasource_name: in ODBC or native data source.
 You must create storage repository in the
 Administrator.
 * registry: in the system registry.
 * cookie: on client computer in a cookie. Scalable.
 If client disables cookies in the browser, client
 variables do not work

params.name: this.setClientCookies
params.description:
No: CFML does not automatically send CFID and CFTOKEN
 cookies to client browser; you must manually code CFID and
 CFTOKEN on the URL for every page that uses Session or
 Client variables

params.name: this.sessionManagement
params.description: enables session variables

params.name: this.sessionTimeout
params.description:
Lifespan of session variables. CreateTimeSpan function and
 values in days, hours, minutes, and seconds, separated by
 commas

params.name: this.applicationTimeout
params.description:
Lifespan of application variables. CreateTimeSpan function
 and values in days, hours, minutes, and seconds, separated
 by commas.

params.name: this.setDomainCookies
params.description:
Yes: Sets CFID and CFTOKEN cookies for a domain (not a host)
 Required, for applications running on clusters.

params.name: this.scriptProtect
params.description:
Specifies whether to attempt to protect variables from cross-site scripting attacks.
 - none: do not protect variables
 - all: protect Form, URL, CGI, and Cookie variables
 - comma-delimited list of ColdFusion scopes: protect variables in the specified scopes

params.name: this.secureJSONPrefix
params.description:
CF8+ The security prefix to put in front of the value that a ColdFusion function returns in JSON-format 
				in response to a remote call if the secureJSON setting is true.

params.name: this.secureJSON
params.description:
CF8+ A Boolean value that specifies whether to add a security prefix in front of any value that a ColdFusion function returns in JSON-format
				 in response to a remote call.

params.name: this.customTagPaths
params.description: CF8+ A file path to a directory containing custom tags.

params.name: this.mappings
params.description: CF8+ A structure of application mappings where they key is the mapping and the value is the directory path.

params.name: this.welcomeFileList
params.description: CF8+ A comma seperated list of file names that will skip onMissingTemplate invocation - typically only necessary if you are using a builtin web server like Tomcat or JRun.

params.name: this.serverSideFormValidation
params.description: CF9+ Enable/Disable ColdFusionâ€š server side validation on CFFORM.

params.name: this.googleMapKey
params.description: CF9+ the google maps api when cfmap is used.

params.name: this.datasource
params.description: CF9+ Defines the default datasource for the application. As of CF9.0.1+ it can also accept a struct with keys: name, username, password.

params.name: this.s3
params.description: CF9+ A struct with keys accessKeyId, awsSecretKey and defaultLocation.

params.name: this.ormEnabled
params.description: CF9+ Set to true if you want to use ORM.

params.name: this.ormSettings
params.description: CF9+ A struct with various Hibernate / ORM configuration options. For details see: https://helpx.adobe.com/coldfusion/developing-applications/coldfusion-orm/configure-orm/orm-settings.html

params.name: this.smtpServerSettings
params.description: CF9+ A struct with possible keys: server, username and password.

params.name: this.timeout
params.description: CF9+ The default request timeout in seconds for requests within the application. Can be overridden by the cfsetting tag.

params.name: this.debuggingIPAddresses
params.description: CF9+ A list of IP addresses which show debugging output when debugging is enabled in the Administrator.

params.name: this.enableRobustException
params.description: CF9+ Overrides the value of the ColdFusion Administrator checkbox "Enable Robust Exception Information" for the application.

params.name: this.sessioncookie.httpOnly
params.description: CF10+ Specifies if the session cookies (CFID/CFTOKEN) should have the HTTPOnly cookie flag set. This prevents the cookie value from being read from JavaScript.

params.name: this.sessioncookie.secure
params.description: CF10+ Specifies if the session cookies (CFID/CFTOKEN) should have the secure cookie flag set. When true the cookies are only sent over a secure transport (eg HTTPS).

params.name: this.sessioncookie.domain
params.description: CF10+ Specifies the cookie domain the session cookies (CFID/CFTOKEN).

params.name: this.sessioncookie.timeout
params.description: CF10+ Specifies the expires value of the session cookies (CFID/CFTOKEN), in days. Set to -1 for browser session cookies.

params.name: this.sessioncookie.disableUpdate
params.description: CF10+ Prevents the session cookies (CFID/CFTOKEN), from being updated by cfcookie or cfheader tags.

params.name: this.javaSettings.loadPaths
params.description: CF10+ An array of paths containing jar files or java classes.

params.name: this.javaSettings.loadColdFusionClassPath
params.description: CF10+ Loads the classes using ColdFusions classloader.

params.name: this.javaSettings.reloadOnChange
params.description: CF10+ Watches the files specified in loadPaths and reloads classes on change.

params.name: this.wsChannels
params.description: CF10+ An array of structs used to define WebSocket communication channels.

params.name: this.sameFormFieldsAsArray
params.description: CF10+ When two form fields are passed with the same name their values will be put into an array when this setting is true.

params.name: this.compileExtForInclude
params.description: CF11+ When cfinclude is invoked only file extensions in this list are compiled and executed as CFML, otherwise they are statically included as a string for improved performance and security. You can use * as a wildcard for all.

params.name: this.security.antiSamyPolicy
params.description: CF11+ Path to an AntiSamy XML policy file for use with isSafeHTML and getSafeHTML functions.

params.name: this.strictNumberValidation
params.description: CF11+ Makes isValid, cfargument, cfparam, and cfform more strict with reguard to how the treat integer or numeric validation when the string contains a currency.

params.name: this.inMemoryFileSystem.enabled
params.description: CF11+ Enables or disables in memory file system.

params.name: this.inMemoryFileSystem.size
params.description: CF11+ Memory limit in MB for the in memory file system.

params.name: this.datasources
params.description: CF11+ Create multiple an application specific datasources. This value is a structure whos keys are the name of the datasource to be created, and the values are another structure with keys such as: database, driver, host, username, password, url. Lucee / Railo also support this setting, but are configured with keys class, connectionString, username, password

params.name: this.serialization.preserveCaseForStructKey
params.description: CF11+ Preserves the case of your variable names when generating json using the serializeJSON function.

params.name: this.customSerializer
params.description: CF11+ The name of a CFC pointing to a custom serializer. See https://helpx.adobe.com/coldfusion/developing-applications/changes-in-coldfusion/restful-web-services-in-coldfusion.html

params.name: this.locale
params.description: Lucee4+ The default locale used for formatting dates, numbers.

params.name: this.timezone
params.description: Lucee4+ The default timezone used for date handling.

params.name: this.sessionType
params.description: Lucee4+ Use cfml or jee based sessions.

params.name: this.sessionStorage
params.description: Lucee4+ The name of the storage provider for session variables.

params.name: this.localeMode
params.description: Lucee4+ Defines how the local scope of a function is invoked when a variable with no scope definition is used. When classic the local scope is only invoked when the key already exists in it, with modern the local scope is always assumed on unscoped variables.

params.name: this.scopeCascading
params.description: Lucee4+ Depending on this setting Lucee scans certain scopes to find a variable when the variable is called without a scope (For Example: #myVar# instead of #variables.myVar#). When strict, only scans the variables scope, small only scans variables, url, and form scopes. When standard (the ColdFusion standard way) scans all scopes: variables,cgi,url,form,cookie

params.name: this.typeChecking
params.description: Lucee4+ If set to false Lucee ignores type defintions with function arguments and return values

params.name: this.compression
params.description: Lucee4+ Enables Gzip compression on the HTTP response when true

params.name: this.passArrayByReference
params.description: CF2016+ `true`: Arrays will be passed by reference instead of by value for this application.

params.name: this.searchImplicitScopes
params.description:
CF2016+ Defines the way non-scoped variables are found.
`false`: Only the variables, local and arguments scopes are searched.
`true`: Default and < CF2016 behaviour. All scopes are searched in the following order: local, arguments, thread local, query, thread, variables, cgi, cffile, url, form, cookie, client.

examples.title: Simple Application.cfc Example
Adding relative mappings in Application.cfc
examples.description: This example uses getCurrentTemplatePath and getDirectoryFromPath to dynamically get the directory that the current Application.cfc resides in and then defines some mappings relative to that. You want to avoid using expandPath in Application.cfc because the path will be relative to the current template path not the Application.cfc path.

examples.title: Defining WebSocket Channels
examples.description: The minimum required to create a WebSocket channel is the name attribute. A channel can also specify a custom channel listener CFC, if not specified the ChannelListener.cfc, available in wwwroot/CFIDE/websocket directory is called (Using Channel Listeners). Note: Though you can use any number of sub-channels, you do not specify them as they are dynamically created (dot notation). To subscribe to channels you create a WebSocket object using the cfwebsocket tag in your CFM template.

examples.title: Relative mappings - Advanced Example
examples.description: This example shows how to map to directories that are a level up from the Application.cfc (web root) as well as how to handle an application that will need to be deployed on multiple operating systems (Mac, Unix, Windows) due to differing developer environments. It uses Find to determine if we need to use forward or back slashes in our paths and ListDeleteAt to drop the current directory from the path. We can then build the path for our mappings and custom tags using this information.
